items.title: Xi’s Price-War Campaign Creates a Buzz in China’s Stock Market
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- For strategists at JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. as well as money managers in Hong Kong and Singapore, an opaque term has suddenly emerged as the catchphrase for deciphering Chinese policy intentions and navigating the stock market.Most Read from BloombergSinger Akon’s Failed Futuristic City in Senegal Ends Up a $1 Billion ResortWhy Did Cars Get So Hard to See Out Of?How German Cities Are Rethinking Women’s Safety — With TaxisPhiladelphia Trash Piles Up as Garb

items.title: Worst Spate of Downgrades Since 2021 Signals Pain
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- Credit rating downgrades are becoming more frequent, the latest sign that companies are starting to perform worse and raising fresh questions about whether corporate debt valuations should be as high as they are. items.title: Five Themes for Investors to Watch as Earnings Season Kicks Off
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- In just three months, US stocks have swung from a dramatic April selloff to new heights. items.title: Core CPI In Focus With JPMorgan, Goldman, Netflix Set To Report Earnings
items.description: This week witnesses earnings from banking giants like JPM, WFC, BAC, BLK. Investors may also look at Core CPI and Core PPI on Tuesday and Wednesday.
